title: Product of Conjugates Pattern
text: We compare our expression to the product of conjugates pattern formula: $$\left(a-b\right) \left(a+b\right)=a^2-b^2$$.
speech: We compare our expression to the product of conjugates pattern formula:  parentheses a minus b,  times, parentheses a plus b,  is equal to, a squared minus b squared .

title: Compare the Binomials\n
text:
In a conjugate pair, it does not matter which binomial comes first, as long as one binomial is a sum and the other is a difference.
$$\left(a-bight) \left(a+bight)$$
$$\left(a+bight) \left(a-bight)$$
$$\left(x+ rac{3}{4}ight) \left(x- rac{3}{4}ight)$$
speech:
In a conjugate pair, it does not matter which binomial comes first, as long as one binomial is a sum and the other is a difference.
 parentheses a minus b,  times, parentheses a plus b,  
 parentheses a plus b,  times, parentheses a minus b,  
 parentheses, x plus 3 fourths,  times, parentheses, x minus 3 fourths,

title: Identify a
text: What is a in the expression?
speech: What is a in the expression?

title: Identify $$b$$
speech: What is  b  in the expression?

title: Plug in the Terms
text: Substitute $$a=x$$ and $$b=\frac{3}{4}$$ into the product of conjugates pattern formula:\n$$\left(a+b\right) \left(a-b\right)=a^2-b^2$$\n$$\left(x+\frac{3}{4}\right) \left(x-\frac{3}{4}\right)=x^2-{\left(\frac{3}{4}\right)}^2$$
speech: Substitute  a is equal to x  and  b, is equal to 3 fourths  into the product of conjugates pattern formula:\n parentheses a plus b,  times, parentheses a minus b,  is equal to a squared minus b squared \n parentheses, x plus 3 fourths,  times, parentheses, x minus 3 fourths,  is equal to x squared minus, parentheses 3 fourths  squared
